verses.verse: And there went <WH3212> a man <WH376> of the house <WH1004> of Levi, <WH3878> and took <WH3947> to wife a daughter <WH1323> of Levi. <WH3878>

And the woman <WH802> conceived, <WH2029> and bore <WH3205> a son: <WH1121> and when she saw <WH7200> him that he was a goodly <WH2896> child, <WH3206> she hid <WH6845> him three <WH7969> months. <WH3391>

And when she could <WH3201> not longer <WH5750> hide <WH6845> him, she took <WH3947> for him an ark <WH8392> of bulrushes, <WH1573> and daubed <WH2560> it with slime <WH2564> and with pitch, <WH2203> and put <WH7760> the child <WH3206> therein; and she laid <WH7760> it in the flags <WH5488> by the river's <WH2975> brink. <WH8193>
And his sister <WH269> stood <WH3320> afar <WH7350> off, to wit <WH3045> what would be done <WH6213> to him.

And the daughter <WH1323> of Pharaoh <WH6547> came <WH3381> down <WH3381> to wash <WH7364> herself at <WH5921> the river; <WH2975> and her maidens <WH5291> walked <WH1980> along by the river's <WH2975> side; <WH3027> and when she saw <WH7200> the ark <WH8392> among <WH8432> the flags, <WH5488> she sent <WH7971> her maid <WH519> to fetch <WH3947> it.

And when she had opened <WH6605> it, she saw <WH7200> the child: <WH3206> and, behold, <WH2009> the babe <WH5288> wept. <WH1058> And she had compassion <WH2550> on <WH5921> him, and said, <WH559> This <WH2088> is one of the Hebrews' <WH5680>children. <WH3206>

Then said <WH559> his sister <WH269> to Pharaoh's <WH6547> daughter, <WH1323> Shall I go <WH3212> and call <WH7121> to you a nurse <WH3243> of the Hebrew <WH5680> women, that she may nurse <WH3243> the child <WH3206> for you?
And Pharaoh's <WH6547> daughter <WH1323> said <WH559> to her, Go. <WH3212> And the maid <WH5959> went <WH3212> and called <WH7121> the child's <WH3206> mother. <WH517>

And Pharaoh's <WH6547> daughter <WH1323> said <WH559> to her, Take <WH3212> this <WH2088> child <WH3206> away, and nurse <WH3243> it for me, and I will give <WH5414> you your wages. <WH7939> And the women <WH802> took <WH3947> the child, <WH3206> and nursed <WH5134> it.

And the child <WH3206> grew, <WH1431> and she brought <WH935> him to Pharaoh's <WH6547> daughter, <WH1323> and he became <WH1961> her son. <WH1121> And she called <WH7121> his name <WH8034> Moses: <WH4872> and she said, <WH559> Because <WH3588> I drew <WH4871> him out of the water. <WH4325>

And it came <WH1961> to pass in those <WH1992> days, <WH3117> when Moses <WH4872> was grown, <WH1431> that he went <WH3318> out to his brothers, <WH251> and looked <WH7200> on their burdens: <WH5450> and he spied <WH7200> an Egyptian <WH4713> smiting <WH5221> an Hebrew, <WH5680> one of his brothers. <WH251>

And he looked <WH6437> this <WH3541> way <WH3541> and that way, <WH3541> and when he saw <WH7200> that there was no <WH369> man, <WH376> he slew <WH5221> the Egyptian, <WH4713> and hid <WH2934> him in the sand. <WH2344>

And when he went <WH3318> out the second <WH8145> day, <WH3117> behold, <WH2009> two <WH8147> men <WH582> of the Hebrews <WH5680> strove <WH5327> together: and he said <WH559> to him that did the wrong, <WH7563> Why <WH4100> smite <WH5221> you your fellow? <WH7453>

And he said, <WH559> Who <WH4310> made <WH7760> you a prince <WH8269> and a judge <WH8199> over <WH5921> us? intend <WH559> you to kill <WH2026> me, as you killed <WH2026> the Egyptian? <WH4713> And Moses <WH4872> feared, <WH3372> and said, <WH559> Surely <WH403> this thing <WH1697> is known. <WH3045>

Now when Pharaoh <WH6547> heard <WH8085> this <WH2088> thing, <WH1697> he sought <WH1245> to slay <WH2026> Moses. <WH4872> But Moses <WH4872> fled <WH1272> from the face <WH6440> of Pharaoh, <WH6547> and dwelled <WH3427> in the land <WH776> of Midian: <WH4080> and he sat <WH3427> down by a well. <WH875>

Now the priest <WH3548> of Midian <WH4080> had seven <WH7651> daughters: <WH1323> and they came <WH935> and drew <WH1802> water, and filled <WH4390> the troughs <WH7298> to water <WH8248> their father's <WH1> flock. <WH6629>
And the shepherds <WH7462> came <WH935> and drove <WH1644> them away: but Moses <WH4872> stood <WH6965> up and helped <WH3467> them, and watered <WH8248> their flock. <WH6629>
And when they came <WH935> to Reuel <WH7467> their father, <WH1> he said, <WH559> How <WH4069> is it that you are come <WH935> so soon <WH4116> to day? <WH3117>

And they said, <WH559> An Egyptian <WH4713> delivered <WH5337> us out of the hand <WH3027> of the shepherds, <WH7462> and also <WH1571> drew <WH1802> water enough for us, and watered <WH8248> the flock. <WH6629>
And he said <WH559> to his daughters, <WH1323> And where <WH346> is he? why <WH4100> is it that you have left <WH5800> the man? <WH376> call <WH7121> him, that he may eat <WH398> bread. <WH3899>
And Moses <WH4872> was content <WH2974> to dwell <WH3427> with the man: <WH376> and he gave <WH5414> Moses <WH4872> Zipporah <WH6855> his daughter. <WH1323>
And she bore <WH3205> him a son, <WH1121> and he called <WH7121> his name <WH8034> Gershom: <WH1648> for he said, <WH559> I have been <WH1961> a stranger <WH1616> in a strange <WH5237> land. <WH776>

And it came <WH1961> to pass in process <WH7227> of time, <WH3117> that the king <WH4428> of Egypt <WH4714> died: <WH4191> and the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> sighed <WH584> by reason <WH4480> of the bondage, <WH5656> and they cried, <WH2199> and their cry <WH7775> came <WH5927> up to God <WH430> by reason <WH4480> of the bondage. <WH5656>
And God <WH430> heard <WH8085> their groaning, <WH5009> and God <WH430> remembered <WH2142> his covenant <WH1285> with Abraham, <WH85> with Isaac, <WH3327> and with Jacob. <WH3290>
And God <WH430> looked <WH7200> on the children <WH1121> of Israel, <WH3478> and God <WH430> had respect <WH3045> to them.
